vulnerability_findings.name: state-variable-read-in-a-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Replace state variable reads and writes within loops with local variable reads and writes.

vulnerability_findings.name: state-variable-read-in-a-loop

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(nToken == vals.length && vals.length == exps.length, "invalid array length");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(nToken == vals.length && vals.length == exps.length, "invalid array length");
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in Oracle.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.6.0']
	- Oracle.sol#3 declares pragma solidity^0.6.0
	- Oracle.sol#4 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in Oracle.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.6.0 (Oracle.sol#3): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_ACL' of Oracle. (Oracle.sol#17) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_ACL' of Oracle.setACL (Oracle.sol#27) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: Integer Arithmetic Bugs (SWC 101)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation. 
Classification: SWC-101
